module.p:
clach mhór a big stone –
Tha na clachan sin mór.
Those stones are big. td. 248

càrn chlach a cairn of stones, clach air càrn a stone on a cairn –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne. Bha càrn chlach air mullach na beinne. Chuir Calum clach air a’ chàrn agus shuidh e ri taobh a’ chùirn a’ leigeil analach.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. There was a cairn of stones on the top of the mountain. Calum put a stone onto the cairn and he sat down beside the cairn having a rest. td. 146

cuir ... clach ... ... puts a stone ... –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne. Bha càrn chlach air mullach na beinne. Chuir Calum clach air a’ chàrn agus shuidh e ri taobh a’ chùirn a’ leigeil analach.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. There was a cairn of stones on the top of the mountain. Calum put a stone onto the cairn and he sat down beside the cairn having a rest. td. 146

buail ... le cloich ... strikes ... with a stone –
An do bhuail i an gille le cloich? Cha do bhuail.
Did she strike the boy with a stone? No, she didn’t. td. 44
